abstract: Relations between India and Pakistan continue to decline as both countries accuse each other of targeting civilians during exchange of cross-border fire.
lead_paragraph: Nearly a dozen deaths from cross-border violence have been reported after planned talks between the countries’ security advisers were canceled.

headline.main: India and Pakistan Accuse Each Other in Deaths of Civilians
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Pakistan: Civilians Killed as Troops Trade Fire With India in Kashmir

snippet: Nearly a dozen deaths from cross-border violence have been reported after planned talks between the countries’ security advisers were canceled.
